alert.note: Alert for Gallatin Valley; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 1:29PM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...The Mountains of Southwestern Montana south of Interstate 90, and Gallatin Valley. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The period of coldest, and most extreme, wind chills are expect through Saturday morning. Wind chills over Monida and Raynolds Pass may exceed 40 below zero for several hours tonight.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Gallatin Valley; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains
